title: Actualization through assertion
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Acting out (Psychology)
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Teachers - Training of
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Nonverbal communication
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Personality
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Psychology
description: Four clients are seen in group assertion training, developing a style by practicing appropriate eye contact, gestures, body movement, touch, facial expression, voice tone and volume. Therapists are seen directing the client's progress and reinforcing small successes. Practice assignments are given in which newly learned skills are applid to situations in client's daily lives.
